definition: Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: China is a country of courtesy and propriety.
sentences.chinese: 中華民族是個講究儀禮的國家。

sentences.english: Taoist Ritual Space and Dynastic Legitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 道教的儀禮空間與王朝的正統性。

sentences.english: He demands that His people worship Him alone and with pure hearts and right motivations, not hypocritically with outward man-made ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 祂要的是單一純潔敬拜祂的心，而非虛僞做作的儀禮。

sentences.english: Yili was an important book of Confucianism.

definition: Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
Yang Xiong (53 BC-18 AD), scholar, poet and lexicographer, author of the first Chinese dialect dictionary 方言[Fang1 yan2]
"Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
